Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Perioperative Management of Renin-Angiotensin System Inhibitors

Trial_Design.evidence: patients aged ≥60 years undergoing elective noncardiac surgery were randomised 1:1

Participants.evidence: patients aged ≥60 years undergoing elective noncardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to either stop or continue RAS inhibitors

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial assessed the effect of discontinuing renin-angiotensin system (RAS) inhibitors on perioperative myocardial injury

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was myocardial injury, defined as plasma high-sensitivity troponin-T ≥15 ng/L or a ≥5 ng/L increase within 48 hours post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was centrally performed with minimisation by centre, surgical procedure, and RAS inhibitor type

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to investigators, clinicians, and patients

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were not specifically reported

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under ISRCTN17251494

Funding.evidence: Funding was provided by the Royal College of Anaesthetists and the National Institute for Healthcare Research
